Instance.description:
An interaction that fundamentally acts like another, arbitrary interaction, but wraps it so it can run some specific functionality.
For example, consider a hypothetical cheat that disables autonomous interactions on an arbitrary object. We could define a NonAutonomousInteraction(ProxyInteraction) class, which overrides the allow_autonomous to always return False. The syntax NonAutonomousInteraction.generate(interaction) would return a class subtype of interaction, but that would always have allow_autonomous return False.
